intro: Ornithogalum bivalve, commonly known as the two-valved star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its erect, leafy stems and clusters of star-shaped white flowers. The plant produces small, spherical berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation, it is often used in rock gardens and as a border plant.
